Step 1: firstly, in a cooker heat oil.

 Step 2: furthermore, saute bay leaf, cinnamon stick and cumin seeds till they turn aromatic.

 Step 3: add finely chopped onions and ginger-garlic paste. saute till it turns golden brown.
 also add tomatoes and saute till they start releasing oil.

 Step 4: further, add chilli powder, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, aamchur powder, garam masala and salt. saute for a minute. then add soaked chickpea. make sure to soak chickpea overnight.
 followed by 2 cups of water.

 Step 5: further, give a good mix. and check the seasonings.

 Step 6: pressure cook for 7-8 whistles on medium flame.

 Step 7: allow the pressure to release by itself before opening cooker.

 Step 8: mix well and garnish coriander leaves.

 Step 9: finally, serve with bhatura
